isis.stitle: TSI 93-16-11 - Instructions to Remove and Replace Electric Windshield Wiper Motor Assembly

subjectgroup.subject: Instructions to Remove and Replace Electric Windshield Wiper Motor Assembly

geninfo.para: This TSI applies to 92/93/9400 models built after June 29, 1993 and 96/9700 models built after August 1, 1993.

Electric windshield wipers became standard on 92/93/9400 model vehicles built starting on June 29, 1993 and 96/9700 model vehicles built starting on August 1, 1993. This letter contains service information to remove and replace the electric wiper motor assembly on these vehicles.

step1.para: Remove right instrument panel.
Remove instrument panel to dash panel brace.
Disconnect electrical connector from wiper motor ( Figure 1).
Remove 4 screws that secure the wiper motor mounting plate to the dash panel ( Figure 1).

Pull the motor assembly rearward far enough to remove the spring clip that holds the wiper linkage on the pivot arm ( Figure 2). Remove the linkage from the pivot arm ( Figure 1). DO NOT REMOVE THE PIVOT ARM FROM THE WIPER MOTOR.
Remove the wiper motor assembly.

note.para: Replacement wiper motors are supplied with the motor attached to the mounting plate and the pivot arm attached to the motor shaft. DO NOT remove the mounting plate or pivot arm during installation.
Lubricate the ends of the linkage before installing on the pivot arm with EP2 Moly Grease or Equivalent.

step1.para: Hold the motor assembly in position and install the right and then the left linkage on the pivot arm. Install spring clip ( Figure 3).
Install 4 screws that secure the wiper motor mounting plate to dash panel (see Figure 1).
Connect electrical connector to wiper motor ( Figure 1).
Operate wipers and check for proper operation.
Re-install instrument to dash panel brace.
Re-install right instrument panel.
Remove the fuse/circuit-breaker panel cover and the center section of the instrument panel.
Remove the screw that secures the instrument panel support rod to the dash panel and rotate the rod to allow clearance to remove the defroster flexible hose ( Figure 4 and Figure 5).

Remove the screws that secure the defroster flexible hose to the defroster duct that services the left (driver side) windshield. Remove the flexible hose from the defroster duct and lay back out of the way ( Figure 5).
To gain access to the wiper motor, pull wire harness next to wiper motor toward the instrument panel about 3 or 4 inches.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury from electrical shock and/or fire, or damage to the vehicle, do not allow your tools to touch any electrical connector behind the instrument panel.

step1.para: Remove the two T30 Torx head machine screws (Item 11, Figure 6) at the top of the wiper motor mounting plate that secure it to the dash panel.

The bottom of the wiper motor mounting plate is secured to the dash panel with 2 pins (Item 6, Figure 6). To remove the mounting plate, it is necessary to move it to the left to disengage the pins from the dash panel. If the mounting plate will not move, and the motor will operate, turn the wipers on and momentarily turn the ignition key on. This will break the mounting plate loose and allow it to be disengaged from the dash. It may be necessary to repeat this procedure to break the plate loose from the dash.
If the wiper motor will not operate, it may be necessary to tap the motor assembly toward the driver side to release it from the slots in the dash panel.

After the motor assembly has been released from the slots in the dash, move motor assembly far enough away from the dash to gain access to the spring clip that secures the wiper linkage to the pivot arm on the wiper motor. Remove the spring clip ( Figure 2) and linkage from the pivot arm. DO NOT REMOVE THE PIVOT ARM FROM THE WIPER MOTOR.
Disconnect the electrical connector from the motor and remove the motor assembly.

figure.caption: Figure 4. Center Instrument Panel Section Removed
Figure 5. Instrument Panel Support Rod and Defroster Hose Removed

note.para: Replacement wiper motors are supplied with the motor attached to the mounting plate and the pivot arm attached to the motor shaft. DO NOT remove the mounting plate or pivot arm during installation.
Lubricate the swivel ends of the linkage before installing on the pivot arm with EP2 Moly Grease.

step1.para: Connect electrical connector to wiper motor.
Install right and then left wiper linkage on the pivot arm and secure with spring clip ( Figure 3).

Position the pins on the bottom of the mounting plate in the 2 slots in the dash panel ( Figure 6). Move the motor assembly to the right until the upper holes in the mounting plate are lined up with the screw holes in the dash panel ( Figure 6).

It may be necessary to use a small drift to align the mounting plate holes with the screw holes in the dash panel. Install the T30 Torx head screws to secure the motor assembly to the dash panel ( Figure 6). Tighten both screws.
Operate the wipers and check for proper operation. Be sure wipers are operating properly before proceeding with the following steps.
Install flexible defroster hose to defroster duct. Secure with screws.
Rotate the instrument panel support rod into position on the dash and install screw ( Figure 4).
Install center instrument panel and fuse/circuit breaker panel cover.
